popt4jlib.GA

Class DGA

  • java.lang.Object
    • popt4jlib.GA.DGA
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ObserverIntf, OptimizerIntf, SubjectIntf

    public class DGA
extends java.lang.Object
implements OptimizerIntf, SubjectIntf, ObserverIntf
    The DGA class implements a thread-safe parallel Distributed Genetic Algorithm that follows the island-model of GA computation, with an elitist selection strategy that uses roulette-wheel selection of individuals based on their fitness (that is computed every generation). The GA allows crossover and mutation operators to act on the populations' indidivuals' chromosomes to produce new individuals. It also features some less common properties, such as:
    • 1. a migration model that is based on "island starvation", i.e. whenever an island (run by a dedicated thread, DGAThread) has very small population as measured either on absolute numbers (0) or in relative numbers (less than the population of another island divided by 2.5), then the "near-empty" island becomes a host for migrating individuals (which shall be the "best" from their respective islands).
    • 2. an aging mechanism via which individuals are removed from the population once they reach their (randomly drawn from a Gaussian distribution) generation limit.

    Both the above mechanisms are intended to reduce premature convergence effects of the process that often plague genetic evolution optimization processes. Finally, the class implements the Subject/ObserverIntf interfaces so that it may be combined with other optimization processes and produce better results. By implementing the SubjectIntf of the well-known Observer Design Pattern, the class allows any observer objects implementing the ObserverIntf to be notified whenever a new incumbent is found and then to enrich the class's population (in island thread with id=0) by adding back into the first island's population new (hopefully better) solutions. The solutions moved back and forth between optimizers have to be moved as function argument objects and not as chromosome objects.

    Title: popt4jlib

    Description: A Parallel Meta-Heuristic Optimization Library in Java

    Copyright: Copyright (c) 2011-2015

    Company:

    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Ioannis T. Christou

      void addIncumbent(ObserverIntf obs, java.lang.Object soln)

      the most important method of the class.
      void notifyChange(SubjectIntf subject)
      when a subject's thread calls the method notifyChange, in response, this object will add the best solution found by the subject, in the _subjects' solutions map, to be later picked up by the first DGAThread spawned by this DGA object.

      notifies every ObserverIntf object that was registered via a call to registerObserver(obs) -and has not been removed since- by calling the ObserverIntf object's method notifyChange(SubjectIntf this).

      the optimization params are set to p

      moves all chromosomes that the observers or subjects have added so far to the _individuals List of the DGAThread with id 0, and clears the solutions from the _observers and _subjects maps.

    • Constructor Detail

      • DGA

        public DGA()
        public constructor. Provides a unique String id to the object that is "DGA."+getId() which is used e.g. in the Barrier method calls, and initializes the _observers and _subjects data member.

      • DGA

        public DGA(java.util.Hashtable params)
        public constructor. The parameters to be used by the minimize(f) method are passed in as the single argument to the method. The parameters are uniquely owned by the DGA object.

   boolean setParamsOnlyFromSameThread)

        Parameters:
        params - Hashtable

      • setParams

        public void setParams(java.util.Hashtable p)
               throws OptimizerException
        the optimization params are set to p
        Parameters:
        p - Hashtable
        Throws:
        OptimizerException - if another thread is concurrently running the minimize(f) method of this object. Note that unless the 2-arg constructor DGA(params, use_from_same_thread_only=true) is used to create this object, it is perfectly possible for one thread to call setParams(p), then another to setParams(p2) to some other param-set, and then the first thread to call minimize(f).

      • registerObserver

        public boolean registerObserver(ObserverIntf observer)
        allows an Object that implements the ObserverIntf interface to register with this DGA object and thus be notified whenever new incumbent solutions are produced by the DGA process. The ObserverIntf objects may then independently produce their own new solutions and add them back into the DGA process via a call to addIncumbent(observer, functionarg). The order of events cannot be uniquely defined and the experiment may not always produce the same results.
        Specified by:
        registerObserver in interface SubjectIntf
        Parameters:
        observer - ObserverIntf.
        Returns:
        boolean returns always true.

      • removeObserver

        public boolean removeObserver(ObserverIntf observer)
        removes an Object that implements the ObserverIntf that has been registered to listen for new solutions. Returns true if the observer was registered, false otherwise.
        Specified by:
        removeObserver in interface SubjectIntf
        Parameters:
        observer - ObserverIntf
        Returns:
        boolean

      • notifyObservers

        public void notifyObservers()
        notifies every ObserverIntf object that was registered via a call to registerObserver(obs) -and has not been removed since- by calling the ObserverIntf object's method notifyChange(SubjectIntf this).
        Specified by:
        notifyObservers in interface SubjectIntf

      • getIncumbent

        public java.lang.Object getIncumbent()
        returns the currently best known function argument that minimizes the _f function. The ObserverIntf objects would need this method to get the current incumbent (and use it as they please). Note: the method is not synchronized, but it still executes atomically, and is in synch with the DGAThreads executing setIncumbent().
        Specified by:
        getIncumbent in interface SubjectIntf
        Returns:
        Object

      • addIncumbent

        public void addIncumbent(ObserverIntf obs,
                java.lang.Object soln)
        allows an ObserverIntf object to add back into the DGA process an improvement to the incumbent solution it was given. The method should only be called by the ObserverIntf object that has been registered to improve the current incumbent.
        Specified by:
        addIncumbent in interface SubjectIntf
        Parameters:
        obs - ObserverIntf
        soln - Object

      • notifyChange

        public void notifyChange(SubjectIntf subject)
                  throws OptimizerException
        when a subject's thread calls the method notifyChange, in response, this object will add the best solution found by the subject, in the _subjects' solutions map, to be later picked up by the first DGAThread spawned by this DGA object.
        Specified by:

        Throws:

      • minimize

        public PairObjDouble minimize(FunctionIntf f)
                       throws OptimizerException
        the most important method of the class. Some parameters must have been previously passed in the _params map (passed in the ctor or via prior call to setParams(p) to do that). These are:
        • <"dga.randomchromosomemaker",RandomChromosomeMakerIntf maker> mandatory, the RandomChromosomeMakerIntf Object responsible for creating valid random chromosome Objects to populate the islands.
        • <"dga.xoverop", XoverOpIntf xoverOp> mandatory, the XoverOpIntf Object that produces two new chromosome Objects from two old chromosome Objects. It is the responsibility of the operator to always return NEW Objects.
        • <"dga.mutationop", MutationOpIntf mutationOp> optional, if present, the operator will always be applied to the resulting Objects that the XoverOpIntf will produce, default is null.
        • <"dga.numthreads",Integer nt> optional, how many threads will be used, default is 1. Each thread corresponds to an island in the DGA model.
        • <"dga.c2amaker",Chromosome2ArgMakerIntf c2a> optional, the object that is responsible for transforming a chromosome Object to a function argument Object. If not present, the default identity transformation is assumed.
        • <"dga.a2cmaker",Arg2ChromosomeMakerIntf a2c> optional, the object that is responsible for transforming a FunctionIntf argument Object to a chromosome Object. If not present, the default identity transformation is assumed. The a2c object is only useful when other ObserverIntf objects register for this SubjectIntf object and also add back solutions to it (as FunctionIntf args)
        • <"dga.numgens",Integer ng> optional, the number of generations to run the GA, default is 1.
        • <"dga.numinitpop",Integer ip> optional, the initial population number for each island, default is 10.
        • <"dga.poplimit",Integer pl> optional, the maximum population for each island, default is 100.
        • <"dga.xoverprob",Double rate> optional, the square root of the expectation of the number of times cross-over will occur divided by island population size, default is 0.7.
        • <"dga.cutoffage",Integer maxage> optional, the number of generations an individual is expected to live before being removed from the population, default is 5.
        • <"dga.varage", Double varage> optional, the variance in the number of generations an individual will remain in the population before being removed, default is 0.9.
        • <"ensemblename", String name> optional, the name of the synchronized optimization ensemble in which this DGA object will participate. In case this value is non-null, then a higher-level ensemble optimizer must have appropriately called the method Barrier.setNumThreads(name+"_master", numParticipantOptimizers) so as to properly synchronize the various participating optimizers' threads. Also, if this object is to be re-used as a stand-alone optimizer, this key-value pair must be removed from its parameter-set via a call to setParams(p) prior to calling minimize(f) again. If the optimizer ensemble is to call its minimize(f) method again, then it must make sure to have reset the Barrier.getInstance(name+"_master") object via a 
           
 Barrier.removeInstance(name+"_master");
 Barrier.setNumThreads(name+"_master", numOptimizers);
 ComplexBarrier.removeInstance(name);
          series of calls.

          This implementation requires that the value of the key "dga.poplimit" multiplied by the value of the key "dga.numthreads" times the value of the key "dga.numgens" is less than the value of the call parallel.MsgPassingCoordinator.getMaxSize() that currently returns 10000 (otherwise, there is the risk of the method hanging up in pathological circumstances when all enough individuals in the population are current incumbents). If this requirement is not met, an OptimizerException will be thrown.

        Specified by:
        minimize in interface OptimizerIntf
        Parameters:
        FunctionIntf - f
        Returns:
        PairObjDouble Pair<Object arg, Double val>
        Throws:
        OptimizerException - if the optimization process fails; also see above discussion
